Subject: 24. Content Security Policy Not Implemented
Description:
AIC 11.5

Impact:
An attacker can execute cross domain scripts on the application to perform attacks like XSS.

Recommendation:
1. Enable CSP on your website by sending the Content-Security-Policy in HTTP response
headers that instructs the browser to apply the policies you specified.
2. Implement CSP header as mentioned below:
Content-Security-Policy: script-src 'self'; OR
<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="script-src 'self';">
3. Apply the whitelist and policies as strict as possible.

References:
Industry Standard:
https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/REST_Security_Cheat_Sheet.html

Steps to Reproduce:
Verify the response headers for CSP
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c: Verify the response headers for CSP
Solution_Comment__c: confirmed, "Content-Security-Policy" security header was added to AIC and Webserver in 11.6+.
